caption: It's really only three stars , the fourth star is because it's so well hidden. But worth a peak if you're in the area .
A small &neat church. It's on the list of monument historique.
Lovely historic church at the top end of Rue Charrone. Worth a visit if passing and some nice local cobbled streets
They just trolling with their endless bell every morning idk
Nice place to visit with the family specially on Sundays
Very nice church
Cool
Nice

A beautiful Gothic country church that was the village of Charonne in the Middle Ages, of which it was the nucleus and the end of the main street Saint-Blaise which retains the appearance of the old times until today. The altar of the church and the powerful pillars of the nave, perfectly preserved, give the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe rustic Gothic style in the heart of Paris. The cemetery is remarkable for its village cemetery appearance on a hill.
Memories of an ancient village in Paris, you‚Äôd think you were in the countryside

It is a magnificent little church from the 12th to the 18th century, with a small adjoining cemetery which gives it a country feel in this ancient village of Charonne which has become a district of Paris.  It is in this place that St Germain would have met for the first time and blessed little Ste Genevi√®ve, who became the patron saint of Paris.  A flight of steps leads there, the church overlooking a small village square lined with cobbled streets. I recommend this prayerful and rural place.

My mother's funeral took place yesterday September 12 at 2 p.m. Very beautiful church. On the other hand, we are all shocked by the priest's 'performances'. Not a hint of empathy, in a hurry to read the gospels and get it over with... No one was able to follow his reading, poorly adjusted microphone and incomprehensible reading, apart from the text that I had entrusted to him. What a shame in this moment of contemplation and sorrow.
Beautiful and noble building, pretty adjoining parish cemetery and almost secret passage for direct access to P√®re Lachaise. Great place in a neighborhood that is just as great.

A remains of the village of Charonne. It feels like a province. To discover, the church and its small cemetery.  With the trees in flower, a little romantic side. When you stand in front of the church door, you almost expect to see Lino Ventura appear with his top hat and tails.!!!!

Small village church in the heart of Paris, whose origins date back to the Middle Ages. Pretty little cemetery around which reinforces the bucolic side. Historical visits are organized 4 times a year (inquire at the presbytery)
Very simple little church. The organ was playing there when I went there, thank you üôè

The only church in Paris with its cemetery still in use today. It dominates rue Saint-Blaise. For the record, a scene from ‚Äúuncle gunslingers‚Äù was filmed there. A charming old gentleman can give you a wealth of information and Grisou the cat will happily accompany you through the aisles.
Picturesque square and pretty church, it feels like a village
Intimate church located on the heights of the 20th arrondissement of Paris.
A small and pretty church. To discover with its cemetery behind

This church is a living stone in the hearts of the parishioners who attend it. Led by a community of enthusiasts, the services are the conjunction of humility and sharing, of welcome and friendship, of prayer and listening. Passing tourists discover it with amazed eyes. Movie buffs will remember the cult scene from the film, Don‚Äôt Touch the Grizzbi.

Very old church in Paris that still preserves the cemetery attached to the church. It is located in the 20th arrondissement. As the story goes, the bishop of Auxerre, Saint Germain, around the year 430, had an encounter with a young woman from Nanterre, Saint Genevieve, who later became the patron saint of Paris.
It is a church built at the beginning of the 12th century and finished in the 18th century, you must visit it and nothing prevents you from meditating
One of the most beautiful churches in Paris with its cemetery, I highly recommend going through the door of the building which is worth the detour. A country feel in the heart of Paris. It's magical!

This is the charm of a country church of good architecture.    Its adjoining cemetery is quite unique in Paris (the other would be in Montmartre, almost always closed). Perched on a hill too.    We hears great concerts at very very reasonable prices. I pass by it every 8 days without getting tired

Very beautiful little restored neighborhood church which includes a Romanesque part (12th century) and the rest 15th-18th century. its very interesting little cemetery (some great writers) is just behind the church. Tontons Flingueurs filming location.
Magnificent village church, bordered by its cemetery! A unique setting in Paris

Very beautiful church which has retained its beautiful energy of love, with its magnificent horgue, its village feel. Since the first confinement I discovered it, I felt good about it because I like its medieval side... Thank you to the priests of this parish for being present to maintain the masses in this important place.

Definitely one of my favorite churches in Paris. Its age, completely medieval in Romanesque art, its cemetery in the immediate vicinity, typically Celtic; the interior silence conducive to meditation, contemplation and contemplation, make it a church where it is good to stop.

Charming little church, partly Romanesque and essentially Gothic, one of the oldest in Paris, the only one with St Pierre de Montmartre to have preserved its romantic little cemetery; all in the picturesque old St Blaise district, near P√®re Lachaise. It has the advantage of remaining open to the public all day long. Visit for a pleasant change of scenery.
Village church - originally around Paris - which has miraculously come down to us.

Beautiful Gothic church in more or less good condition. Surrounded by a cemetery, one of the last examples in Paris. From this place the last scene of the film "les Tontons Flingueurs" was filmed where we see rue Saint Blaise with cars. Today pedestrian.

Very beautiful Romanesque church located at the top of rue Saint Blaise. Like a small village in the countryside with its very quiet little cemetery. Marie de Miribel, founder of the works of the Croix Saint Simon is buried there, as are the children of Andr√© Malraux. The neighborhood is well worth a little detour.

A sentimentally important place for me, the village church of Charonne is a fabulous historical monument, nestled in a small corner of greenery. It overlooks a small, magnificent cemetery in this neighborhood which has retained a very particular and peaceful atmosphere. A must-visit if you are in the area! Not far from P√®re Lachaise. For film buffs, it has hosted several film shoots, including The Bride Was in Black, Les tontons flingueurs.

As I work right next door, I made this church the highlight of a beautiful walk in the Saint Blaise district. I ended my walk with one of the oldest medieval churches in Paris. I was a little disappointed to be honest but I really enjoyed the whole walk and I would have been frustrated not to see this church.
A great, beautiful place in Paris

very often discretion has charm, and this phrase translates its full meaning when visiting this garden located between the church and rue Stendhal. in spring/summer the vegetation is abundant so romance is added to the picture.

Former church in the village of Charonne before integration into Paris. It is one of the two churches with the church of Montmartre to have an adjoining cemetery. The church has parts dating back to the Middle Ages.
